data.text:
This attribute, when TRUE, indicates that the 40 MHz
Operation is implemented. The default value of this attribute is FALSE.
data.name: dot11FortyMHzOperationImplemented

data.text:
This attribute, when TRUE, indicates that the 40 MHz
Operation is enabled. The default value of this attribute is FALSE.
data.name: dot11FortyMHzOperationEnabled

data.text:
This attribute indicates the operating channel. If 20/40 MHz
Mode is currently in use then this attribute indicates the primary channel.
data.name: dot11CurrentPrimaryChannel

data.text:
This attribute indicates the channel number of the secondary
channel. If 20/40 MHz mode is not currently in use, this attribute value
shall be 0.
data.name: dot11CurrentSecondaryChannel

data.text:
This attribute indicates the maximum number of spatial
streams implemented. The default value of this attribute is 2.
data.name: dot11NumberOfSpatialStreamsImplemented

data.text:
This attribute indicates the maximum number of spatial
streams enabled. The default value of this attribute is 2.
data.name: dot11NumberOfSpatialStreamsEnabled

data.text:
This attribute, when TRUE, indicates that the HT Greenfield
option is implemented. The default value of this attribute is FALSE.
data.name: dot11GreenfieldOptionImplemented

data.text:
This attribute, when TRUE, indicates that the HT Greenfield
option is enabled. The default value of this attribute is FALSE.
data.name: dot11GreenfieldOptionEnabled

data.text:
This attribute, when TRUE, indicates that the Short Guard
option is implemented for 20 MHz operation. The default value of this
attribute is FALSE.
data.name: dot11ShortGIOptionInTwentyImplemented

data.text:
This attribute, when TRUE, indicates that the Short Guard
option is enabled for 20 MHz operation. The default value of this attribute
is FALSE.
data.name: dot11ShortGIOptionInTwentyEnabled

data.text:
This attribute, when TRUE, indicates that the Short Guard
option is implemented for 40 MHz operation. The default value of this
attribute is FALSE.
data.name: dot11ShortGIOptionInFortyImplemented

data.text:
This attribute, when TRUE, indicates that the Short Guard
option is enabled for 40 MHz operation. The default value of this attribute
is FALSE.
data.name: dot11ShortGIOptionInFortyEnabled

data.text:
This attribute, when TRUE, indicates that the LDPC coding
option is implemented. The default value of this attribute is FALSE.
data.name: dot11LDPCCodingOptionImplemented

data.text:
This attribute, when TRUE, indicates that the LDPC coding
option is enabled. The default value of this attribute is FALSE.
data.name: dot11LDPCCodingOptionEnabled

data.text:
This attribute, when TRUE, indicates that the entity is
capable of transmitting frames using Space-Time Block Code (STBC) option.
The default value of this attribute is FALSE.

data.text:
The current operating frequency channel of the DSSS
PHY. Valid channel numbers are as defined in 15.4.6.2
data.name: dot11CurrentChannel

data.text:
dot11CCAModeSupported is a bit-significant value, representing all of the CCA modes supported by the PHY. Valid values are:
energy detect only (ED-ONLY) = 01,
carrier sense only (CS-ONLY) = 02,
carrier sense and energy detect (ED-and-CS)= 04
or the logical sum of any of these values. This attribute shall
not be used to indicate the CCA modes supported by a higher rate
extension PHY. Rather, the dot11HRCCAModeSupported attribute shall
be used to indicate the CCA modes of the higher rate extension PHY.
data.name: dot11CCAModeSupported

data.text:
The current CCA method in operation. Valid values are:
energy detect only (edonly) = 01,
carrier sense only (csonly) = 02,
carrier sense and energy detect (edandcs)= 04.
carrier sense with timer (cswithtimer)= 08
high rate carrier sense and energy detect (hrcsanded)= 16
data.name: dot11CurrentCCAMode

data.text: The current Energy Detect Threshold being used by the DSSS PHY.

data.text: The number of the current operating frequency channel of the OFDM PHY.
data.name: dot11CurrentFrequency

data.text:
The Threshold being used to detect a busy medium (frequency).
CCA shall report a busy medium upon detecting the RSSI above this threshold.
data.name: dot11TIThreshold

data.text:
The capability of the OFDM PHY implementation to operate in the three U-NII
bands. Coded as an integer value of a three bit field as follows:
bit 0 .. capable of operating in the lower (5.15-5.25 GHz) U-NII band
bit 1 .. capable of operating in the middle (5.25-5.35 GHz) U-NII band
bit 2 .. capable of operating in the upper (5.725-5.825 GHz) U-NII band
For example, for an implementation capable of operating in the lower and mid
bands this attribute would take the value 3.
data.name: dot11FrequencyBandsSupported

data.text: The table containing RSNA configuration objects.
data.name: dot11RSNAConfigTable

data.text: An entry in the dot11RSNAConfigTable.
data.name: dot11RSNAConfigEntry

data.heading: dot11RSNAConfigEntry 1 has been deprecated.
data.text: The highest RSNA version this entity supports. See 7.3.2.9.
data.name: dot11RSNAConfigVersion

data.text:
This object indicates how many pairwise keys the entity supports
for RSNA.
data.name: dot11RSNAConfigPairwiseKeysSupported

data.text:
This object indicates the group cipher suite selector the entity
must use. The group cipher suite in the RSN Information Element
shall take its value from this variable. It consists of an OUI (the
first 3 octets) and a cipher suite identifier (the last octet).
data.name: dot11RSNAConfigGroupCipher

data.text:
This object selects a mechanism for rekeying the RSNA GTK. The
default is time-based, once per day. Rekeying the GTK is only
applicable to an entity acting in the Authenticator role (an AP in
an ESS).
data.name: dot11RSNAConfigGroupRekeyMethod

data.text:
The time in seconds after which the RSNA GTK shall be refreshed.
The timer shall start at the moment the GTK was set using the MLMESETKEYS.
request primitive.
data.name: dot11RSNAConfigGroupRekeyTime

data.text:
A packet count (in 1000s of packets) after which the RSNA GTK
shall be refreshed. The packet counter shall start at the moment
the GTK was set using the MLME-SETKEYS.request primitive and it
shall count all packets encrypted using the current GTK.
data.name: dot11RSNAConfigGroupRekeyPackets

data.text:
This object signals that the GTK shall be refreshed whenever a STA
leaves the BSS that possesses the GTK.
data.name: dot11RSNAConfigGroupRekeyStrict

data.text:
The PSK for when RSNA in PSK mode is the selected AKM suite. In
that case, the PMK will obtain its value from this object.
This object is logically write-only. Reading this variable shall
return unsuccessful status or null or zero.
data.name: dot11RSNAConfigPSKValue

data.text:
The PSK, for when RSNA in PSK mode is the selected AKM suite, is
configured by dot11RSNAConfigPSKValue.
An alternative manner of setting the PSK uses the password-to-key
algorithm defined in H.4. This variable provides a means to enter a
pass-phrase. When this object is written, the RSNA entity shall use
the password-to-key algorithm specified in H.4 to derive a preshared
and populate dot11RSNAConfigPSKValue with this key.
This object is logically write-only. Reading this variable shall
return unsuccessful status or null or zero.
data.name: dot11RSNAConfigPSKPassPhrase

data.heading: dot11RSNAConfigEntry 11 and dot11RSNAConfigEntry 12 have been deprecated.
data.text:
The number of times Message 1 in the RSNA Group Key Handshake will
be retried per GTK Handshake attempt.
data.name: dot11RSNAConfigGroupUpdateCount

data.text:
The number of times Message 1 and Message 3 in the RSNA 4-Way Handshake
will be retried per 4-Way Handshake attempt.
data.name: dot11RSNAConfigPairwiseUpdateCount

data.text: This object indicates the length in bits of the group cipher key.
data.name: dot11RSNAConfigGroupCipherSize

data.text: The maximum lifetime of a PMK in the PMK cache.
data.name: dot11RSNAConfigPMKLifetime

data.text:
The percentage of the PMK lifetime that should expire before an
IEEE 802.1X reauthentication occurs.
data.name: dot11RSNAConfigPMKReauthThreshold

data.text:
Specifies the number of PTKSA replay counters per association:
0 -> 1 replay counter,
1 -> 2 replay counters,
2 -> 4 replay counters,
3 -> 16 replay counters
data.name: dot11RSNAConfigNumberOfPTKSAReplayCounters

data.text: The maximum time a security association shall take to set up.
data.name: dot11RSNAConfigSATimeout

data.text: The selector of the last AKM suite negotiated.
data.name: dot11RSNAAuthenticationSuiteSelected

data.text: The selector of the last pairwise cipher negotiated.
data.name: dot11RSNAPairwiseCipherSelected

data.text: The selector of the last group cipher negotiated.
data.name: dot11RSNAGroupCipherSelected

data.text: The selector of the last PMKID used in the last 4-Way Handshake.
data.name: dot11RSNAPMKIDUsed

data.text: The selector of the last AKM suite requested.
data.name: dot11RSNAAuthenticationSuiteRequested

data.text: The selector of the last pairwise cipher requested.
data.name: dot11RSNAPairwiseCipherRequested

data.text: The selector of the last group cipher requested.
data.name: dot11RSNAGroupCipherRequested

data.text:
Counts the number of times that a TKIP MIC failure occurred two
times within 60 s and TKIP countermeasures were invoked. This
attribute counts both local and remote MIC failure events reported
to this STA. It increments every time TKIP countermeasures are
invoked
data.name: dot11RSNATKIPCounterMeasuresInvoked

data.text: Counts the number of 4-Way Handshake failures.
data.name: dot11RSNA4WayHandshakeFailures

data.text:
Specifies the number of GTKSA replay counters per association:
0 -> 1 replay counter,
1 -> 2 replay counters,
2 -> 4 replay counters,
3 -> 16 replay counters
data.name: dot11RSNAConfigNumberOfGTKSAReplayCounters

data.text:
This table lists the pairwise ciphers supported by this entity. It
allows enabling and disabling of each pairwise cipher by network
management. The pairwise cipher suite list in the RSN Information
Element is formed using the information in this table.
data.name: dot11RSNAConfigPairwiseCiphersTable

data.text:
The table entry, indexed by the interface index (or all interfaces)
and the pairwise cipher.
data.name: dot11RSNAConfigPairwiseCiphersEntry

data.text: The auxiliary index into the dot11RSNAConfigPairwiseCiphersTable.
data.name: dot11RSNAConfigPairwiseCipherIndex

data.text:
The selector of a supported pairwise cipher. It consists of an OUI
(the first 3 octets) and a cipher suite identifier (the last
octet).
data.name: dot11RSNAConfigPairwiseCipher

data.text: This object enables or disables the pairwise cipher.
data.name: dot11RSNAConfigPairwiseCipherEnabled

data.text:
This object indicates the length in bits of the pairwise cipher
key. This should be 256 for TKIP and 128 for CCMP.
data.name: dot11RSNAConfigPairwiseCipherSize

data.text:
This table lists the AKM suites supported by this entity. Each AKM
suite can be individually enabled and disabled. The AKM suite list
in the RSN information element is formed using the information in
this table.
data.name: dot11RSNAConfigAuthenticationSuitesTable

data.text: An entry (row) in the dot11RSNAConfigAuthenticationSuitesTable.
data.name: dot11RSNAConfigAuthenticationSuitesEntry

data.text:
The auxiliary variable used as an index into the
dot11RSNAConfigAuthenticationSuitesTable.
data.name: dot11RSNAConfigAuthenticationSuiteIndex

data.text:
The selector of an AKM suite. It consists of an OUI (the first 3
octets) and a cipher suite identifier (the last octet).
data.name: dot11RSNAConfigAuthenticationSuite

data.text:
This variable indicates whether the corresponding AKM suite is
enabled/disabled.
data.name: dot11RSNAConfigAuthenticationSuiteEnabled

data.text:
This table maintains per-STA statistics in an RSN. The entry with
dot11RSNAStatsSTAAddress set to FF-FF-FF-FF-FF-FF shall contain
statistics for broadcast/multicast traffic.
data.name: dot11RSNAStatsTable

data.text: An entry in the dot11RSNAStatsTable.
data.name: dot11RSNAStatsEntry

data.text: An auxiliary index into the dot11RSNAStatsTable.
data.name: dot11RSNAStatsIndex

data.text:
The MAC address of the STA to which the statistics in this
conceptual row belong.
data.name: dot11RSNAStatsSTAAddress

data.text: The RSNA version with which the STA associated.
data.name: dot11RSNAStatsVersion

data.text:
The pairwise cipher suite Selector (as defined in 7.3.29.1) used
during association, in transmission order.
data.name: dot11RSNAStatsSelectedPairwiseCipher

data.text:
Counts the number of TKIP ICV errors encountered when decrypting
packets for the STA.
data.name: dot11RSNAStatsTKIPICVErrors

data.text:
Counts the number of MIC failures encountered when checking the
integrity of packets received from the STA at this entity.
data.name: dot11RSNAStatsTKIPLocalMICFailures

data.text:
Counts the number of MIC failures encountered by the STA identified
by dot11StatsSTAAddress and reported back to this entity.
data.name: dot11RSNAStatsTKIPRemoteMICFailures

data.text:
The number of received CCMP MPDUs discarded by the replay
mechanism.
data.name: dot11RSNAStatsCCMPReplays

data.text:
The number of received MPDUs discarded by the CCMP decryption
algorithm.
data.name: dot11RSNAStatsCCMPDecryptErrors

data.text: Counts the number of TKIP replay errors detected.
data.name: dot11RSNAStatsTKIPReplays

data.text:
Station Configuration attributes. In tabular form to allow
for multiple instances on an agent.
data.name: dot11HTStationConfigTable

data.text:
An entry (conceptual row) in the dot11HTStationConfig Table.
ifIndex - Each IEEE 802.11 interface is represented by an
ifEntry. Interface tables in this MIB module are indexed by ifIndex.
data.name: dot11HTStationConfigEntry
Dot11HTStationConfigEntry
data.syntax:
{

     dot11HTOperationalMCSSet       OCTET STRING,

     dot11MIMOPowerSave            INTEGER,   

     dot11NDelayedBlockAckOptionImplemented TruthValue,

     dot11MaxAMSDULength       INTEGER,

     dot11PSMPOptionImplemented       TruthValue,

     dot11STBCControlFrameOptionImplemented TruthValue,

     dot11LsigTxopProtectionOptionImplemented TruthValue,

     dot11MaxRxAMPDUFactor       INTEGER,

     dot11MinimumMPDUStartSpacing       INTEGER,

     dot11PCOOptionImplemented       TruthValue,

     dot11TransitionTime       INTEGER,

     dot11MCSFeedbackOptionImplemented  INTEGER,

     dot11HTControlFieldSupported       TruthValue,

     dot11RDResponderOptionImplemented  TruthValue }

data.text:
This attribute shall specify the set of MCS at which the
station may transmit data. Each octet contains a value representing a rate.
Each MCS shall be within the range from 1 to 127, and shall be supported for
receiving data. This value is reported in transmitted Beacon, Probe Request,
Probe Response, Association Request, Association Response, Reassociation
Request, and Reassociation Response frames, and is used to determine whether
a BSS with which the station desires to synchronize is suitable. It is also
used when starting a BSS, as specified in 10.3.
data.name: dot11HTOperationalMCSSet

data.text:
This is an 8-bit integer value that identifies the configured
power save state of MIMO.
data.name: dot11MIMOPowerSave

data.text:
This attribute, when TRUE, indicates that the station
implementation is capable of supporting the No ack option of the Delayed
Block Ack. The default value of this attribute is FALSE.
data.name: dot11NDelayedBlockAckOptionImplemented

data.text:
This attribute indicates the supported maximum size of AMSDU.
The default value of this attribute is 3839.
data.name: dot11MaxAMSDULength

data.text:
This attribute, when TRUE, indicates that the station
implementation is capable of supporting PSMP. The default value of this
attribute is FALSE.
data.name: dot11PSMPOptionImplemented

data.text:
This attribute, when TRUE, indicates that the station
implementation is capable of processing the received control frames that are
STBC frames. The default value of this attribute is FALSE.
data.name: dot11STBCControlFrameOptionImplemented

data.text:
This attribute, when TRUE, indicates that the station
implementation is capable of supporting L-SIG TXOP Protection option. The
default value of this attribute is FALSE.
data.name: dot11LsigTxopProtectionOptionImplemented

data.text:
This attribute indicates the maximum length of A-MPDU that
the STA can receive. The Maximum Rx A-MPDU defined by this field is equal to
213+dot11MaxRxAMPDUFactor -1 octets. The default value of this attribute is 0.
data.name: dot11MaxRxAMPDUFactor

data.text:
This attribute indicates the minimum time between the start
of adjacent MPDUs within an A-MPDU. This time is measured at the PHY-SAP; the
number of octets between the start of two consecutive MPDUs in A-MPDU shall
be equal or greater than (dot11MinimumMPDUStartSpacing*PHY-bit-rate)/8. The
encoding of the minimum time to this attribute is:
0 no restriction
1 1/4 microsec
2 1/2 microsec
3 1 microsec
4 2 microsec
5 4 microsec
6 8 microsec
7 16 microsec
The default value of this attribute is 0.
data.name: dot11MinimumMPDUStartSpacing

data.text:
This attribute, when TRUE, indicates that the station
implementation is capable of supporting Phased Coexistence Operation. The
default value of this attribute is FALSE.
data.name: dot11PCOOptionImplemented

data.text:
This attribute indicates that the minimum transition time
within which the STA can switch between 20 MHz channel width and 40 MHz
channel width with a high probability. The encoding of the transition time to
this attribute is:
400 microsec
1500 microsec
5000 microsec
The default value of this attribute is 3.
data.name: dot11TransitionTime

data.text:
This attribute indicates the MCS feed back capability
supported by the station implementation. The default value of this attribute
is 0.
data.name: dot11MCSFeedbackOptionImplemented

data.text:
This attribute, when TRUE, indicates that the station
implementation is capable of receiving HT Control field. The default value
of this attribute is FALSE.
data.name: dot11HTControlFieldSupported

data.text:
This attribute, when TRUE, indicates that the station
implementation is capable operating as a RD responder. The default value of
this attribute is FALSE.
data.name: dot11RDResponderOptionImplemented

data.text:
The compliance statement for SNMPv2 entities that implement the
IEEE 802.11 RSN MIB.
data.name: dot11RSNCompliance
